text:
I am not able to install Turing. I guess something is going wrong with github log in information. This is an email I received from them:

You recently used a password to access the repository at PumasAI/Pumas.jl with git using git/2.0 (libgit2 0.28.2).

Basic authentication using a password to Git is deprecated and will soon no longer work. Visit <https://github.blog/2020-12-15-token-authentication-requirements-for-git-operations/> for more information around suggested workarounds and removal dates.

attachments.title: Token authentication requirements for Git operations - The GitHub Blog
attachments.text: Beginning August 13th, 2021, we will no longer accept account passwords when authenticating Git operations on <http://GitHub.com|GitHub.com> and will instead require token-based authentication (for example, a personal access, OAuth, or GitHub App installation token) for all authenticated Git operations.
attachments.fallback: The GitHub Blog: Token authentication requirements for Git operations - The GitHub Blog

elements.text:
I am not able to install Turing. I guess something is going wrong with github log in information. This is an email I received from them:

You recently used a password to access the repository at PumasAI/Pumas.jl with git using git/2.0 (libgit2 0.28.2).

Basic authentication using a password to Git is deprecated and will soon no longer work. Visit
for more information around suggested workarounds and removal dates.

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

Hmm, you shouldn’t need to be logged in to github to install public packages like Turing (in fact, I think Pkg no longer uses github at all for this). You might try
```] rm Turing
] add Turing```
just to make sure you’re adding it the default way
